comments.body: exactly
They should be less useless

How about Iron Golems having the ability to throw blocks at their enemies as a ranged attack, helpful against those nasty Pillagers. Plus a slam attack as an A.O.E. attack, helpful against those nasty Vindicators. Lastly, a charge attack against those nasty Ravagers, Witches, and Evokers. Granted if you decided YOU were going to be the raider, then the Iron Golem would use those special attack on YOU!
I feel they should buff golems or add a new mob that helps protect villages or add a new type of villager that fights back like a rogue villager or warriors.
They should add a cheaper smaller version of the iron golem with a similar height to the snow golem .
This would have to be java exclusive btw if this did become a thing (becaue illusioners are only on java). But why just illusioners? What if we made illusioners with crossbows?
This is a great idea! Maybe it would also work in villages?
Yes yes yes and the llamas would become pillagers and you must add in PE

The Illusioner could also drop a totem of keep inventory.

Maybe they could be sneaking behind the village bell so if you ring or break it you get a random chance that he spawns.

If they are added to raids (and they should btw) and the village bell isn't "infiltrated" yet, one of the raids Illusioners can hide in it.

but they cant, see command

/summon minecraft:turtle ~ ~ ~ {Passengers:[{id:drowned,IsBaby:1}]}

it wont work but

/summon minecraft:squid ~ ~ ~ {Passengers:[{id:drowned,IsBaby:1}]} works therefore Drowned Squid Jockey
I think they should ride dolphins.
Also, drowned hate turtles, so it makes more sense for them to ride dolphins.
(Please stay on topic and try to not suggest alternatives that have already made the Previously Considered Feedback list. Appreciated!)

And they could sing!

 

"They see me rollin' ‚Ä¶ they hatin' ‚Ä¶ tryin' to catch me ridin' turty."

This is a great idea! I was skeptical at first, but you sold me on it! This is great! I like the addition of the stinger arrows! And thanks for writing a well thought-out and balanced idea with lots of details. We need those.

Master level:
7-9 emeralds for a bee nest
EXTREMELY well put together--WE NEED THIS XD
Golden apples count for 3 chorus fruits. Typo.

Oh yeah. Well, maybe their enemy  could be the creeper? The creeper doesn't have any enemies other than ocelot. they will not attack endermen as they were them, and they will run from zombies because I assume that the zombie is them but undead so they will not fight.
I meant so they could not be used as pets againist their own will.
Well, how about they fight the wither if it's spawned. if you watched the vids, then you know that's why they went to the end. So, they would naturally fight the thing that trapped them.
No offense, but I don't really like this idea. I don't think Matpat is correct in this instance.

Thx. That is actually a good idea. You have to train them after the effort of curing them. 

Did you know that there was a human mob? But it looked like Steve and was always hostile.

I will make another post because I want to add a lot new things.  

It will be called, "The Endermen Update"
Made the post, and it is pending approval!

Hello. I am back. Sorry, the post got rejected because I put one link in there, i will put my ideas here. 

New achievement: Free the Endermen! Cure 10 endermen and you will unlock this. The parent is Overpowered.  

XP: The humans have 5 xp from the start. The more mobs they kill, the more xp.

Okay, I am good now. 

Actually, it should be a hidden achievement because the Overpowered achievement  is not in Minecraft anymore. 

 The have 5 xp because they have spent all their time picking up blocks. 

If they see A Wither, they will remember everything. 

Mob dummies: used for target practice. 

They have a list of what they cannot build, kinda like the seed generator. 

Just my ideas. 

They earn experience the same way the player does.
So I think all my comments and post got deleted but I still support this idea 100% üëç was just watching theories on the endermen

its a cool idea worth to become a mod or addon but it kinda ruins the point of discovering lore in the game, plus in minecraft dungeons there are still enderman everywhere but if you could cure it than there wouldn't have been any in the game.
You don't have to feel like your the only one. Because I'm with you On this idea man.
But here's some advice that I can give you. It takes more than just a post on the feedback.minecraft.net website, to get your voice heard [by the community].
This way emeralds would be like real currency with something backing it up
Diamonds should not be a form of currency.
Really? Well I think it‚Äôs sold for really cool things.

It would be cool if the pillagers raid players and villages take theor bases and breed their army to reinforce and strenght their army

For the raiding i would prever to have an "cartographer" pillager that search in their suroundings for villages and player buildings maps them and goes back to his base (if you caught him watching your base he will flee but iff you kill him you are safe until the next catographer comed around to spy on you) after that a bunch off pillagers comes and raids your base and expand to your's (thei also will stay in their base but for expanding purposes they'll take your's too)

Sorry for my bad english üòÖ I come from austria and don't speak or write english
They are NPCs (non-player characters) not PNJs
Si perch√© no
Good idea! I think there should also be a pure skeleton underwater mob, alike the drowned.

I like the idea, but I think skeletal drowned should have some special feature, like always spawning with tridents, or being unarmed, but dragging the player down. Maybe they could use shields? or maybe (since skeletons are smarter than zombies) they would be neutral towards the player if the player is holding a trident/nautilus shell?

Translated:

Let the diamond golems come out that are invoked just like the iron golems but instead of diamond iron
Ok
They could do more damage and severely knock enemies and I was thinking maybe they could be bigger
Zombies con nuevos dise√±os
Nuevos fantasmas
Nuevos animales para comer
It was so good trading eggs for emerald

Please add egg trading back into the game. The decision to take it out of Bedrock significantly and adversely affects game play. If you want to level-set the two editions, add egg trades to Java. I'm perplexed why you would even think removing it from Bedrock was a good idea. Egg trades are a valuable and readily accessible means to obtaining emeralds. While other choices certainly exist, it makes the process far more laborious. It slows down a players ability to explore, build, expand, mine, virtually everything because the other avenues for obtaining emeralds require far more time and effort to obtain them. Please, for the sake of an enjoyable playing experience, bring back egg trading. I want to explore my world, not constantly farm in order to obtain a fraction of the emeralds that eggs produce readily.

I noticed this too when trying to find a farmer to trade eggs.  I tried 5 different farmers and thought I was either extremely unlucky or was losing my mind. I'm very disappointed in minecraft for removing that feature.
This feedback needs to be merged with others suggesting the same thing.

Our family has a realm with dozens of villages.  Removing egg trading screwed up the economics of the villages we spent over a year building.  It took months of dropping farmers in lava and leveling up new ones before realizing this was an intentional "feature."
hiii
MDA
I think that you should have egg trading that way I will have infinite emeralds$$$$$.
Egg trading is extremely, extremely overpowered. All you have to do is set up a few dozen chickens on top of a hopper and you have infinite emeralds. It breaks the game. I don't like this idea.
That is a great idea but it would make more sense if it was I 3 or 4 gold blocks
Yeah, the piglins adore gold, so they should be payed with gold instead.
what about a gold block that would make more sense since piglins love gold so much

I think they should be hired with gold blocks instead, and instead of being healed with gold ingots, they should be healed with either pork chops(they hunt hoglins lol) or gold related food such as golden carrots, golden apples, etc.
It would be cooler if you could hire an entire army

That would be real cool as you sometimes see skeletons have a shootout when they accidentally hit each other instead of the player, so having a bit of tension between different types of hostile mobs would be really interesting.
ok
Nice

I agree that Illagers shouldn't be on the zombies side and it would make the game world a lot more livelier. I have always wished their were more mob interactions in the game and adding stuff like this would be really cool. They would obviously not attack creepers or endermen and the creepers would not attack them like wise. It would be cool though if pillagers attacked creepers too because they would be the only mob to do it and maybe they could do it by walking backwards while shooting their crossbows from a distance at them. They wouldn't attack endermen though... no one wants to pick a fight with a enderman.

I have thought about this alot and totally agree! The only concern i see happening is the mansion is very dark and was designed to have mobs spawn in to add difficulty. Their best bet is to add more light sources in the rooms and hallways and to balance this spawn more illagers in their place.
Interesting!

I think the illagers would focus on killing the zombies, so they would even team up with the iron golems at night.

Perhaps the illagers at woodland mansions are slightly different from the others (like a cult or something) which would explain why not all illagers can use any type of magic. illagers would not attack skeletons unless provoked though, as skeletons don't attack them or villagers.
I have wanted a way to obtain villager robes for who knows how long. Could this villager also sell the weapon smith's eyepatch, farmer's hat, and the armorer's welding goggles?

I like this idea being able to buy villager clothing, however I feel that some of this should be changed, like some of the clothing should be cheaper while others should be more expensive. I have a similar one but mine is a lot simpler than this.

Dialog

IKK
Other villagers shouldn't trade their hats
How about they pull out a flint and steel occasionally to burn down a villager house? Or, we could have an entirely new pillager type meant for burning building, like the "pillager arsonist".
How about no? The villagers have a hard enough time as it is.
What if they only do this after they win a raid?
Rip my tree house

I think they should be allowed to burn down NPC villager houses, but not player ones, because that is called griefing. Why should we lose our progress and our work just because somebody else wanted a feature added in a game? that's bad game design, it's like a rule that should never be broken and there needs to be limits on what hostile mobs can and cannot do in the game to make it fair for everyone involved.
One of the best jokes I've seen all week
i'm not joking

Yes, you are, unless you are asking for a skin pack, in which case you need to update your post for clarity.

I can't believe I actually have to say this, but a UN Armed Forces mob would be so incredibly out of place in this game. Remember also that to add a "soldier from every country around the globe", you'd have to add around two hundred new mobs, which is just absurd. Finally, adding UN Armed Forces mobs would bring war-themed content into the game, which I am almost 100% sure is something the Mojangsters do not want to add to the game under any circumstances.

And even if all that wasn't a consideration, you have not said anything about the spawning mechanics of this mob, what their behavior would be like, what their drops might be, or why they would be important to the game in general, etc. which is all crucial and basic information for any proposal for a new mob.
I'm sorry but I dont really think men of war fit into a game like Minecraft. Make peace, not war.
just...‚Ä¶. why?

What do they do? How do they do it? Just tell me everything about them, alright. This post will be boring and eventually deleted if you do not add any more information. (Although it may get deleted anyway)

If you want this to be added to Minecraft, you need to support your idea, which will be a very hard task for you because you have only persuaded 26 people out of the millions of people who play Minecraft not wanting this added. There are many ideas out there, like skeletaurs (You will out what that means eventually)
Nice joke dude but I honestly don‚Äôt see this getting anywhere at all

..... Look mojang adds stuff like bees and polar bears who are endangered in the real world. They do this to create notice. So maybe adding some kind of soldier mob to defend villages and help players would be a inspiration to those that serve our country or something. That's the only explanation I can think of at least otherwise this post is a waste of time . sorry .
I think, Minecraft developers should either add a new villages (jungle and swamp) or make this feature switchable in world generation setting (I hope, both variants will be in the game).

I think the librarian change is actually quite logical. Sure, it is a setback, but it makes sense that villagers have different resources in different biomes. I personally think that every type of villager should have trades based on the biome they‚Äôre in, not just a random selection that they all choose from.

To the comment that the change is logical. Take a step back and ask why.  

Why does every world have to be the same? In my world, it makes no sense, as part of the story is all villages are equal.

What is Mojang going to do about trading Villagers as a commodity? Or is Mojang on board with that?
If all villages aren't equal, are you going to add an educational system? Other wise that seems like Mojang is supporting bad ideas.
I agree and I think that mainly anvil costs should be lowered and there should be no repair/combine limit on anvil things.

How about a Netherite Anvil?
And also I heard that one of the developers wanted to remove "too expensive".

Frankly the "too expensive" limitation was kind of dumb anyway. Just make it so that if the player would need a certain number of levels, it instead just sets it to an arbitrary high number (like 100).
If a player is going through the effort to get level 100 to use their anvil, then considering that they're also sacrificing resources as well I think it's fair to just let them use their anvil.

Overall its a good idea In my opinion. But as you said there are a lot of things wrong with the current state of things. Villagers having their trades locked to a biome is a cool mechanic and guarantees players that are searching for certain enchanted books that they will get them. However the anvil must receive a complete overhaul, removing the cost and possibly allowing it to be upgraded so it doesn't break all the god damn time! (maybe introduce a reinforced anvil, it could incorporate a netherite ingot in the centre of the crafting recipe instead of the middle iron block)

The premise seems good, but the execution does not sit well. I think to decrease the sting of these changes, an overhaul to how players enchant needs to be done, or at least a method that does not solely rely on the anvil or chance.
Multiple enchantments, from what I have seen, seem to have been removed from the trading lists as well, especially true for tridents and crossbows.

There was a proposal I liked, commented by aelsi2 on a YouTube video by Phoenix SC. It summates to combining books in an anvil still, using the enchantment table to combine the: book, equipment, material components (aelsi2 mentions lapis could be used but that others would be interesting) based on the enchantments of the book, and required levels. This would make the enchant table the better means to add enchantments to items.
Another change I have seen and liked, would be that chiseled book shelves, when filled with 'x' number of an enchanted book, the chance for that enchantment being added to the level 30 enchant increases. Let's say by 5% for treasure enchants and 10% for others, per book to a max of (6 x %). Players would still need 15 bookshelves to reach max, but can now increase the chance of an enchantment already in the enchantment table list and add a chance for a treasure enchantment to the list. This still gives importance to finding books in ruins.

I think these two changes would address the cause of excessive villager trading by reducing both anvil costs and random enchants late game.
There's already an iron golem that protects the village.
Villagers don't want to fight. that's why they have golems
I think that's a good idea

I have also thought on this.

For those of us who love the Medevil format and buildings. This would be so fun.

So let me help to flesh this out if I can and see if this helps.

A player could build a barracks. (combine a bed and chest together to make a bed and foot locker.)
For each one of these created they could hire a villager to become a defender. Thus the payment of 25 emeralds would create a footman. This villager would now become a hireling. Then if there is an armor stand built and combined with the bed and wall locker. The player could put armor on the hireling. So you could use leather or whichever you decide to give them for armor.

25 would get the footman they get a spear
for 50 you can hire an archer or swordsman Archers come in crossbow or bow and is random which you get.

For 75 emeralds you can hire a sergeant of the barracks who comes with sword and shield or two axes.

For 100 Emeralds you can hire a knight.

In this format when we build our castles and or towns we can install barracks. These hirelings wander the village and will respond to mobs.

To balance this every hireling increases the chance of an Illiger raid. Thus the more you hire the more chances you have of being attacked.
This is exactly what I like!
Please make the title clearer, as some (if not most) of the sections places are focused on villagers. But yeah, it would be a cool thing to add and would use the unused jungle villager texture
Maybe generally a Chicken Villager who can sell on step 5 Spawn eggs of some animals.

In 1.16, Bedrock Edition trades were adjusted to match Java Edition, and as a result the farmer egg trade was lost. I would love to see this added back into both editions, especially since eggs don‚Äôt really have that many uses.

This this should definitely be added to java editions. Eggs are only good for breading new chickens but it would nice if you could sell them to villagers for emeralds. Maybe one stack or 16 eggs would = 1 emerald.
I agree, please add this function back into the game.

Please add egg trading back into the game. The decision to take it out of Bedrock significantly and adversely affects game play. If you want to level-set the two editions, add egg trades to Java. I'm perplexed why you would even think removing it from Bedrock was a good idea. Egg trades are a valuable and readily accessible means to obtaining emeralds. While other choices certainly exist, it makes the process far more laborious. It slows down a players ability to explore, build, expand, mine, virtually everything because the other avenues for obtaining emeralds require far more time and effort to obtain them. Please, for the sake of an enjoyable playing experience, bring back egg trading. I want to explore my world, not constantly farm in order to obtain a fraction of the emeralds that eggs produce readily.

Put this back! I spent all day murdering innocent farmers to find a couple only to find that you guys removed this feature. Put it back, please!!! I have entire chicken farms and chests full of eggs based in this mechanism.

PS. For as buggy as this game is and for how often villagers randomly despawn, this leveled things out pretty nicely. Hours and hours and hours of grinding to level up my villagers just to have them disappear overnight even in a fully enclosed walled lid city was just a little bit less ridiculous when I could build chicken farms and sell the eggs for easy emeralds.
This feedback needs to be merged with others suggesting the same thing.
This feedback needs to be merged with others suggesting the same thing.

This suggestion is really cool! I would definitely like to see some humanoid aspect to the illagers. Perhaps even wearing an Ominous (Illager) banner on the player's head slot would make them neutral so you can barter with them like how you must wear gold armor to make the piglins neutral towards you. 

I also like that bartering with the Illagers prevents raids. Drinking milk just seems weird for me. How does drinking milk remove a bad omen? Desperate players that aren't ready to fight raids would be forced to barter with Illagers while sacrificing their village popularity.
Perhaps once you raid a woodland mansion/pillager outpost or stop a raid this function would disappear and they would turn hostile

Extension: If you attack them, they will become fully hostile and will not trade (works like Wolf hostily so just run and come back). And you will not be able to trade with Raiders (and potentially Patrols?) to buff Outposts and Mansion.

Amazing Idea! there should be an illager popularity too, with the higher popularity you get the more gray your skin would get (because illagers are grey villagers)

'

Once your illager popularity is at a high enough level you could there would be a skill tree for the pillager faction where you could:

-summon Pillager Patrols to follow and help you kill hostile mobs

-participate in raids, when you activly participate in a raid for the pillagers the villagers would drop tons of loot such as emeralds and their trades

-ride ravager mounts

and more

This is what I need in my game like NOW.  Friend the Illagers, Raid the villagers, etc.. Trading would be beneficial for those that don't want to deal with scamming villagers. I could use an Evoker that follows me around summoning Vexes to protect me. Pillagers and Vindicators would follow if commanded. Basically, you become the leader. We also need the redstone golems in to protect the illagers.
It would make villagers take more emeralds from you. It should be done with iron ingots
Illager popularity is a good idea they would be passive at your first grade then slowly allow you to ride ravagers. Banners could be attached to you to show the illagers who your team is.
Illagers are angry at all pure-blood humans (Like the player) for how they tortured them for being half witch.
Coal golems could protect you and the pillagers

Seeing vindicators sleep in there beds in mansions would be cool to see while evokers stand guard.

I also like the idea of pillagers sleeping but I like to think witches still like to roam around looking for trouble
Yes, a friend pointed out that witches are supposed to be active at night.
Let them swim, as not allowing them will be too great a disadvantage. Especially since they cannot use range.
And add pistols for the pirates for ranged attacks and they can drop them sometimes when killed
They‚Äôd go well with this suggestion! https://feedback.minecraft.net/hc/en-us/community/posts/360046596251-Undead-shark-the-perfect-predator-
And they have a CUTLASS instead of iron sword
They should have pirate swords
I think they should be trapped in the ship with a hostile swimming creature/mini boss like a shark or squid (or new Minecraft version of a creature) that appears after treasure is looted

Absolutely love this idea, itd be awesome to see parrots also taking refugee on the abandoned pirate ships. Id like to see something special dropped from them though, like new banner recipes only obtained from them. A new skull banner, new parrot banner, ship banner or something else pirate themed. Also have them drop compasses by chance
There‚Äôs a no guns rule so no pistols for the pirates.‚òπÔ∏è Mojang, please remove that rule!!!

I have been struggling with new villagers since the day the update came out. The whole idea of the new villagers to me sounded great. 

They don't seem to work. I rage quit the game after struggling to rebuild my trading hall. At first i did not mind. But the current system seems unworkable. Not a programmer. But am thinking the idea may have been just to big to achive.

I killed off most of my old villagers. After only getting 2 of 15 to work with 1.11.0. And 11.1 seemed to lock remaining into what ever state they were in. I dl old save off realm. Saw that 11.1 did lock profession. But lost the 3rd book on every librarian. Became book and quil. 

 

Decided to kill the old ones off and rebuild trading hall.

But when i had 4 villagers set and locked with station and bed. And a zombie walked by and 2 quit using bed and station. Meaning they did not refresh trades. After 4 days of not being able to play minecraft because i was stuck playing glitchcraft. I rage quit game. A pop up asked me if i was enjoying the game. I naturally said no. I had already reported the bugs. I was requested to post feedback by the popup. 

 

I typed up a long and lengthy description of what had happened. Saw other posts expressing feedback. After calming down i did add a comment with more detail and some valid suggestions. The post was pending.

 

It has since been deleted. I guess they don't want honest feedback on how frustrating this is.

 

I described 2 paths. Either scapping the new aspects of villages and villagers and revert back to doors and old style perma born professions.

 

Or doing the following. 

 

Keep the new trading menu and price thing. I would still like to see the option of glowstone as well as dust. Playing survival i buy a ton of glowstone to light up builds.

 

Either bring back doors or have beds act like doors. Number of beds or doors sets breeding limits. Beds or doors follow the same mechanics before on range and village recoqnition. This should be a quick fix since it has already existed. Then you would have simple method to define a village and ctr of village.

Along with this. Get rid of the idea of locking a villager to a bed. It makes as much sense as locking a door in old village so that only 1 villager can use it. Villagers can sleep in a bed if one in village is available but should not be a requirement. Just make it simple and reduce risk of current and future bugs that will make game suck like it has for me last few days.

 

With that trades should reset every new day cycle. Regardless if bed was used. This again is simple and less likely to bug out and make game suck.

 

On professions. I suggested that all non nitwit villagers. Even unemployed villagers to have a menu. And in that menu you can select the profession you want. Again simple to keep game working and not sucking.

Or have villager in cart/boat or walking. Locked in room and so on. Will take profession of closest reachable station. And have option in trading menu to lock and unlock that profession. I don't like this since the last 6 days have cured me of my desire for new villagers. And if not going back. Want something that will work and be bug proof.

 

The idea of villagers locking a station seems a bad idea in application. Think villagers being able to share station is easier and more bug proof. If a villager has a path to a station they should be able to use to refresh trades. But don't lock them. This will remove the crap i have been dealing with. If they don't have access to station. Then they won't refresh until next day. Again this will make the game diminished not broken if or more likely when the next bug tries to cripple the game.

 

I also asked for game setting for classic villagers villages like ps4 had for classic crafting. I can't begin to explain how much damage this had done to my enjoyment to the game. Then to find they deleted the comment. 

My realm subscription is almost up. If not fixed soon thinking about not keeping it. And looking at hytale as option over glitchcraft. And if they keep deleting feedback might not wait for even that.
Fully add the Illusioner!
Also add it to mansions
add the arch illeger

They are the strongest illager
And been in java edition for a long time plz notch! Plz Dinnerbone pleaze! Jeb_! Do it moment I believe in you

It is such a cool mob, but it should spawn NATURALLY, instead of having to summon it with commands. It would also drop some nice loot... ILLUSIONER ARMOR!!! If you had a full set then you could hit shift and left click at the same time and it would summon a clone with half of your characters current health. the clone would fight for the person that summoned it until he dies.
